page.title: 05Housing in Woodlesford
page.content: There is a large variety of housing in the Woodlesford/Oulton area.The oldest houses are on the Aberford road which was where Oulton clustered round until about fifty years ago.For that was when Oulton really started developing.Some of the old houses have the dates of when they were built on them,one of them dating back to 1699.Most of the old houses are made of sandstone which was quarried in Oulton.The newest houses in Oulton/Woodlesford are the North Lane estate houses which were built only 15_16 years ago.There are private houses,and there are also council houses in the old North Lane estate which were built on land formerly owned by the Calverly's who built them between the Great Wars.
